summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York notifying someone that they may be accidentally receiving emails forwarded to them along with the Epstein team, indicating potential email list or forwarding issues within the prosecution team.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email notifying about accidentally forwarded emails involving the Epstein team.

events.title: Email about accidental forwarding
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney sends an email stating they might be accidentally receiving emails forwarded to them along with the Epstein team, noting this also happened a few weeks prior.

locations.name: One Saint Andrew's Plaza
locations.context: Address of the Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office where the email originates.

locations.name: Southern District of New York
locations.context: Federal judicial district handling the Epstein case.

keyFacts: An Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York reports accidental email forwarding involving the Epstein team.
The email suggests potential communication or distribution list issues within the prosecution team handling the Epstein case.
This incident occurred around September 2019, during the active investigation/prosecution phase following Epstein's arrest.
The correspondence indicates ongoing coordination or information sharing among the 'Epstein team' within the U.S. Attorney's Office.
